question_stem: The equation \(3x^2 + 5x + p = 0\), where \(p\) is a constant, has two distinct real roots.

parts.question_text: Find the set of possible values of \(p\).
parts.solution_text:
For the quadratic equation \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\) to have two distinct real roots, the discriminant \(b^2 - 4ac\) must be greater than 0.

In this case, \(a=3\), \(b=5\), and \(c=p\).  So we have:

\(5^2 - 4(3)(p) > 0\)
\(25 - 12p > 0\)
\(25 > 12p\)
\(p < \frac{25}{12}\)
